summary: This is an FBI Daily News Briefing email from March 30, 2023, summarizing news articles of interest to the FBI. It covers a wide range of topics including counterterrorism, counterintelligence, criminal investigations, and Capitol violence news. The briefing mentions numerous ongoing investigations and legal proceedings, but contains no specific information related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Mentioned in articles about China threats, TikTok security concerns, and the FBI's mission. He spoke at Anderson University about China and addressed Capitol riot investigations.

persons.name: Merrick Garland
persons.context: Appeared in multiple articles defending the FBI's budget, FISA surveillance powers, and a 2021 memo about threats against school officials.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in numerous articles regarding investigations, potential indictment, false claims about the Presidential Records Act, and his social media activity.

persons.name: Ivana Trump
persons.context: Subject of a newly revealed secret FBI investigation from the late 1980s/early 1990s, as reported in a news article summary.

persons.name: Mike Pence
persons.context: A federal judge ruled he must testify in the January 6 probe, though he can remain silent on some topics related to his Senate role.

persons.name: Enrique Tarrio
persons.context: Defendant in a seditious conspiracy trial related to the January 6 Capitol riot. An FBI informant testified for the defense.

persons.name: Audrey Hale
persons.context: The transgender Nashville school shooter whose manifesto is to be released after FBI review.

persons.name: Roy McGrath
persons.context: Former chief of staff to Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan who disappeared before his criminal trial. The FBI is offering a reward for information.

persons.name: Mark Meadows
persons.role: Former White House Chief of Staff
persons.context: Former Trump aide ordered to testify in the January 6 probe, a decision Trump appealed.

persons.name: Shou Zi Chew
persons.context: Testified before Congress about TikTok's operational independence from China.

persons.name: Rand Paul
persons.context: Blocked a push by Sen. Josh Hawley to ban TikTok, citing free speech concerns.

persons.name: Josh Hawley
persons.context: Pushed to ban TikTok in the United States, a move blocked by Sen. Rand Paul.

persons.name: Ted Cruz
persons.context: Demanded Big Tech companies disclose details about coordination with federal agencies on misinformation.

persons.name: Barry Loudermilk
persons.context: Released findings to clear his name regarding a January 5, 2021, Capitol tour investigation.

persons.name: Richard Barnett
persons.context: An Arkansas man found guilty on eight charges related to the January 6 riot; his lawyer argued for acquittal.

persons.name: Christopher Worrell
persons.context: A man linked to the January 6 insurrection whose legal guardian dined with Donald Trump.

persons.name: Hridindu Sankar Roychowdhury
persons.context: Former research assistant arrested for the firebombing of a Wisconsin pro-life center, identified via DNA from a burrito.

persons.name: Robert R. Wells
persons.context: Commented on the arrest in the Wisconsin pro-life center firebombing case.

persons.name: Gregory W. Ehrie
persons.role: Former FBI Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: Quoted in an article about a former Marine charged with killing his girlfriend.

persons.name: Ben Crump
persons.context: Attorney for the family of Shanquella Robinson, demanding answers about her death in Mexico.

persons.name: Bridget Brennan
persons.role: New York City Special Narcotics Prosecutor
persons.context: Announced the bust of a NYC drug ring peddling pills in various shapes.

persons.name: O'Neal Jackson III
persons.context: Glynn County interim police chief who announced teens were identified in the Trent Lehrkamp torture case.

persons.name: James Boasberg
persons.context: Ruled that Mike Pence must testify in the January 6 probe.

persons.name: Beryl Howell
persons.context: Issued an order directing Mark Meadows and other Trump aides to testify in the January 6 probe, which Trump appealed.

persons.name: Caitlin Berg
persons.context: A woman who claims she infiltrated a conservative dating app and reported January 6 rioters' details to the FBI.

persons.name: Elvis Chan
persons.context: Named in Sen. Ted Cruz's letters to tech companies regarding coordination on misinformation.

persons.name: Andrew McCabe
persons.context: Mentioned in an opinion piece as someone who faced criticism from Donald Trump.

connections.description: Former President and Vice President. Pence is being compelled to testify about Trump's actions related to January 6.
Trump was president and Meadows was his White House Chief of Staff. Trump is appealing an order compelling Meadows to testify.
Former spouses. The document reveals Ivana Trump was secretly investigated by the FBI in the late 1980s/early 1990s.
An FBI informant identified as 'Aaron' testified for the defense at Tarrio's seditious conspiracy trial.
FBI Director and Attorney General, respectively. Garland defended the FBI's budget and surveillance powers.
Sen. Cruz's inquiry into tech company coordination with government named FBI Agent Elvis Chan as a point of contact.
Trump dined with the legal guardian of January 6 defendant Christopher Worrell.

events.title: FBI Daily News Briefing
events.description: Compilation and distribution of news articles relevant to the FBI, covering counterterrorism, counterintelligence, criminal investigations, and other topics.

events.title: U.S. Capitol Riot
events.description: The attack on the U.S. Capitol. Multiple articles reference ongoing investigations, trials, and testimony related to the event.

events.title: Release of Ivana Trump FBI Investigation Docs
events.description: Newly released documents obtained via FOIA reveal the FBI secretly investigated Ivana Trump in the late 1980s/early 1990s.

events.title: FBI Informant Testifies in Proud Boys Trial
events.description: An FBI informant identified as 'Aaron' testified for the defense at the seditious conspiracy trial of former Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio.

events.title: FBI Arrests BreachForums Operator
events.description: The FBI arrested Conor Brian Fitzpatrick, alleged operator of the BreachForums online market for stolen data.

events.title: Wisconsin Pro-Life Center Firebombing
events.description: A firebombing attack on the headquarters of Wisconsin Family Action. A suspect was arrested in March 2023 via DNA evidence.

events.title: Warrant for Roy McGrath's Arrest
events.description: A federal arrest warrant was issued for Roy McGrath for failure to appear at his criminal trial.

keyFacts: The document is an FBI internal news briefing summarizing media reports from March 30, 2023, and contains no direct information about Jeffrey Epstein or his associates.
Newly released documents revealed a previously secret FBI investigation into Ivana Trump from the late 1980s and early 1990s.
An FBI informant testified for the defense in the seditious conspiracy trial of former Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio.
The FBI is offering a $20,000 reward in the manhunt for Roy McGrath, former chief of staff to Maryland Governor Larry Hogan, who failed to appear for his criminal trial.
A suspect in the firebombing of a Wisconsin pro-life center was identified via DNA from a half-eaten burrito he discarded in a public trash can.
